name: Basil Club - Recipe Site
desc:
A personal recipe collection. Adapted recipes from well-known sources, organized for easy reference while baking.

I wanted to create a 'clean' version of my recipes, since many online recipe websites are cluttered with ads and lengthy stories.

name: Basil Club - 3D Webapp
desc:
An interactive 3D caf√©. Contains multiple interactables and references, inspired by personal experiences.

I wanted to explore creative web development, especially since I had prior experience in 3D software. The project taught me how to optimize 3D assets for performance, and how to create an immersive experience.

name: BrushHub
desc:
A frontend showcase aimed at demonstrating the concept and user experience of an artwork commissioning platform.

This project was practice for proper UX/UI design based on an initial Figma draft.

name: nahidaQuest!
desc:
An incremental game based on the popular hit Genshin Impact, built entirely from scratch. Playable on modern desktop and mobile browsers.

I learned much of the basics of web development from this project, as I didn't rely on many external libraries or frameworks.

name: 2D Heat Diffusion
desc:
Simulates heat transfer by conduction through a two dimensional plate. Computationally solves the heat partial differential equation and visualizes the solution as a heatmap.

This was my first time using a scientific computing platform, and it was important for learning data analysis and numerical methods for solving real-world problems.

name: The Lair
desc:
A fictional online storefront set in a world populated by vampires.

This was my first time using a web framework, with the project focused on learning how to maintain a consistent theme throughout the user experience.
